questions.question: Would you slow down a bit, please? I can't _________ you.
_____ at the door before entering please.
The men will have to wait all day ______ the doctor works faster.
Mr. Smith, there’s a man at _____ front door who says he has_______news for you of great importance.
John said he’d been working in the office for an hour, _______ was true.
Hundreds of jobs______ if the factory closes.
If this dictionary is not yours,_______can it be?
---- Did you remember to give Mary the money you owed her?---- Yes, I gave it to her_______I saw her.
I’ve won a holiday for two to Florida. I _______ my mum.
—Why haven’t you bought any butter?—I _______to, but I forgot about it.
A new cinema_______here. They hope to finish it next month.
I read about it in some book, does it matter_______it was?
Many people have helped with canned food; however, the food bank needs_____for the poor.
Sit down and rest. You need to _______your energy for the tennis match this afternoon.
_______late in the morning, Bob turned off the alarm.
In that case, there is nothing you can do_______than wait.
I am surprised that you should have been fooled by such a （an）_______trick.
One learns a language by making mistakes and _______them.
______can you expect to get a pay raise.
—Write to me when you get home.—_________
With its rapid growth in population, the city _____ in all directions in the past five years.
- Why did you go back to the shop? - I left my friend _____ there.
- Where is my blue shirt? - It's in the washing machine. You have to wear _____ different one.
People have heard what the President has said; they are waiting to see _____ he will do.
If you're driving to the airport, can you give me a _____?
Four of Robert's children were at the party, including _____, Luke.
Naturally, after I tell her what to do, my daughter _____ go and do the opposite!
The manager, _____ his factory's products were poor in quality, decided to give his workers further training.
- Thanks for the lovely party and the delicious food. - _____.
Sally worked late in the evening to finish her report _____ her boss could read it first thing next morning.
Mr. Hall understands that _____ math has always been easy for him, it is not easy for the students.
The man we followed suddenly stopped and looked as if _____ whether he was going in the right direction.
The silence of the library _____ only by the sound of pages being turned over.
- Your coffee smells great! - It's from Mexico. Would you like _____?
Perhaps we need to clear away these books to make _____ for our new students.
Some passengers complain that it usually ____ too long to fill in travel insurance documents.
I don’t think it’s my ____ that the TV blew up. I just turned it on. That’s all.
My grandfather is as ____ as a young man and hates sitting around doing nothing all day.
Broadly speaking, I would agree with Shirley, though not ____.
Tony is ________ the guidebook, looking for information about Japan, where he will travel soon.
One of the consequences of our planet’s being warming up is a(n) ____ in the number of natural disasters.
Those who change mobile phones frequently will pay a heavy price for being____.
Her talent and experience ____ her to the respect of her colleagues.
The engine of the ship was out of order and the bad weather ____ the helplessness of the crew at sea.
A farmer now holds sheep races on a regular basis, and during the past year over 10,000 people have ____________ to watch the race.
The sales man said that __________ thief was a young man with __________ brown hair.
Nowadays, people usually think if you enter a key university, you are your parents' __________.
When Edison invented the light bulb, he tried over 2,000 experiments __________ he got it to work.
The public transportation is very convenient in that big city, so there _________ be any difficulty in traveling around.
It is reported that the 2006 FIFA World Cup __________ on June 9 in Germany.
--- What is the meaning of the saying "Whenever you fall, pick simething up."?--- It tells us to __________ hope even when coming across failure; try to learn something valuable from it
--- Everyone was at the party except you. What happened?--- I ______ after Max, my pet dog, at home. He was ill.
His mother worried that he spent too much time on the computer and not enough time _________.
I was shocked by the news, which made me realize __________ terrible problems we would face.
Taiwan-born filmmaker Ang Lee won the best director Oscar at the 78th Academy Awards, __________ the highest honor in American movie fields.
--- Tom has hurt his leg.--- Really? __________?
Today's basketball match __________ as one of the most exciting matches that these two teams have ever played.
Ebay, Amazon and Wal-Mart are popular websites __________ people can sell goods to each other.
He is always helping people without expecting anything __________.
With ticket prices rising, TV __________ over as the typical way of watching a game for the young and old.
I'm _________ a big journey. I'll visit all the places of interest here
While driving through the city, she showed me the building __________ she once worked.
A woman tearfully explained _________ she had recently lost her husband in a car accident.
It was an easy test and he should have passed, but he __________.
A driver is asked to keep his safety belt __________ while driving on the freeway.
The high-speed railway __________ in 2018, when the World Expo is held in the city.
--- I would never trust him again. He let me down.--- __________.
When __________ a question, one should answer it as clearly as possible.
The shop was caught in a storm and many passengers were reported missing, which got their folks at home ___________.
I was almost killed the other day. A car passed me at __________ I thought was a dangerous speed.
When Edison invented the light bulb, he tried over 2,000 experiments _______ he got it to work.
-- "Whenever you fall, pick simething up." What does this saying mean?-- It tells us to _________ hope even when coming across failure; try to learn something valuable from it.
He's always helping people without expecting anything ______.
Stick to what you think is right, ____ you will gain a surprising happy ending.
I'm ______ a big journey. I'll visit all the places of interest here.
It was nine years ago, when I went to France for the first time, ______ I began to learn French.
A woman tearfully explained ______ she had recently lost her husband in a car accident.
No one can _______ how the election will turn out, as there are many unknown facts.
-- I would never ever trust him again. He let me down.-- _________.
When ______ questions in class, one should answer them as clearly as possible.
I wish I ______ a chance to talk with you about my writing before you left.
With two children _______ college in other states, the parents are working hard.
To all the famous artists' surprise, the unknown woman's two _________ paintings are also on show in the art exhibition.
Young man, if you hurry up, I think ______ quite ______ that you will catch the next train.
-- Were all the toys for the children carried to their new kindergarten?-- No, ______ only some of them.
Without my glasses, I couldn't ______ whether that figure on the blackboard was a three or eight.
-- Did Tim come back a little earlier last night?-- Yes, it was not yet 12 o'clock ______ he arrived home.
Many children have formed the habit of reading but ______ notes meanwhile.
I'll be ready to go as soon as I ______ putting the clean dishes away.
I admire those people. ______ having little money, they feel happy and satisfied.
Although she hates her stepmother, ______ she goes to see her for the love of her father.
It's been years ______ I painted a picture as beautiful as this one.
______ will do good to a senior student to have a part-time job -- they will know more about society.
______ our earth, or else it will be no longer fit for us to live on.
Online shopping, when properly ______, can save us a lot of time and energy.
I still doubt ______ the price of houses will go down, but just wait and see.
-- Why don't you buy the necklace since you like it so much?-- I ______, but I dont' have the money.
-- I feel really disappointed not to have got that job.-- Don't worry, maybe something better will _________.
You've made a few mistakes in your essay, but _________ it's well written.
Distance learning is being ______ in some countries to help children in remote rural schools obtain higher education.
He treasured the notebook in which ______ his bank account passwords and his friends' addresses.
I looked at it and found that including the wine, the bill ___________ $80.
During our staying in London, we paid a visit to the hospital founded _________ the nurse Florence Nightingale.
To go on until you succeed is _______ life is all about.
Johnson knows much about the movie. I think that he must have seen it, _________?
The two men were _________ of receiving stolen property, which made their parents worried.
It is only on the world market ______ we can prove the competitiveness and quality of our goods.
Not only ________________, but also most of their boring or difficult work is unnoticed.
Eating too much fat can _________ heart diseases and cause high blood pressure.
All of us want very much to see these movies, especially _____ you referred to just now.
Spiders are not an insect, as many people think, _____ even nearly related to them.
Mother tole me to play with our little guest. _________, though unwillingly.
When he said he wanted to apply for a ______ in the corporation, he was told to see the manager.
If you don't have anything nice to say to other people, don't say __________.
You may depend on ______ that your parents will help you whenever you need it.
Our city has developed into a big city, which is ____________ it used to be.
answers: four times the size of what
four times the size larger than what
as four times the size as that

questions.question: I don't feel well. I think I'm __________ with the flu.
You know in some countries, ______ are called "public schools" are not owned by the public.
Mom, let me play the computer games, _________?
Do you expect ______ to be a possibility that more and more students from poor families will be able to go to college?
All the information we have collected in relation to that case ______ very little.
______ is known to us all, the old scientist, ______ life was hard in the past, still works very hard in his eighties.
His idea of having weekly family meals together, which seemed difficult at first, has _________ many good changes in their lives.
This book is ______ great value. ______ can be enjoyed from it until you have a deep understanding of it, however.
When I go out in the evening, I use the bike _________ the car if I can.
______ I admire David as a poet, I do not like him as a man.
Considering the present birth rate, the prediction that the world population will decrease in the near future simply does not _________.
The professor reminded me of what I would ______ have forgotten.
-- Do you think we can get there on time?-- Yes, ______ the car doesn't break down.
Whether you believe it or not, it is _________ that causes your illness.
________twice a year, whether it is a car or a truck, is the rule that every driver must obey in this city.
More and more people try to avoid public transportation delays by using their own cars, and this ______ creates further problems.
The number of the photocopiers they produced this year has increased ______ 30% compared with ______ of last year.
Near the table _______ a poor dog, who desired to satisfy his hunger with ______ fell from the table.
The little boy was allowed to go swimming __________ he stayed near the other boys.
______ to keep an even temperature, so the structure of the newly-built house warms and dries out gradually.
The weather was good in L.A., ______ there was bad weather near Chicago.
They are still __________ the missing child, who disappeared last Sunday after attending her friend's birthday party.
Did you hear that Jim was robbed during his recent trip to Thailand? Not only ______ his money, but he was nearly killed.
On hearing the news that her husband was killed by terrorists, the wife _________.
Americans eat ______ vegetables per person today as they did in 1910.
It's the protection of the trees ______ really matters, ______ how many trees are planted each year.
We hoped to be able to move into our new house at the end of the month, but things didn't _________ as we expected.
The most important thing to keep in mind when ______ an emergency is to stay ______.
I couldn't do my homework with all that noise _________.
-- Why does she always ask you for help?-- Because there is no one else _________.
He finally won the general election because many of his promises were quite popular ______the voters.
The bad news about the company ______ a wave of selling its shares.
I'm sure this painting is not by Picasso. It's only an unsuccessful fake and so it's ______.
